Posts.Title: My visit with the therapist swmmom swmmom

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 06:29AM Patti746 wrote: I know just how you feel. The doctors say something to you, and then you go home and say "what do they really mean by that," what are they not telling me"? I finished my chemo in California and came home to CT to get just Herceptin. They started with the CAT scans, MRI's and started talking about nodules in the lungs. They have now found out my carodid artery in my neck is clogged and I have to have surgery for that. It just never ends. I'm having trouble sleeping and feel nervous all the time. Pat

Posts.Content: May 17, 2008 11:52PM Patti746 wrote: This may be a dumb question, but what is A/C? I will be receiving my 5th round of chemo on 5/29 (getting 6 all together) and then will get Herceptin for 6 more months. After my 4th treatment I was really wiped out, with pains in my legs, and now I've started to get dizzy when I stand. I'm on Taxotere, Carboplatin and Herceptin every 3 weeks. The day after I receive Neulasta and a bag of something for hydration. Has anyone else felt dizzy?

Posts.Content: May 17, 2008 09:26PM Patti746 wrote: My surgery was in December 2007. I had 2 tubes in and they went to my waist, but I had a long bra that had attachments on it. When they took the tubes out, it did not hurt at all. I was really surprised. My surgery area after the tubes were out filled with fluid and they had to remove the fluid by a needle, and then it was fine.

I know when I was first diagnosed I woke up in the morning and that was the first thing I thought of "I have cancer". After the treatment it got a little better. Now I just feel "What else is wrong with me"? I have an appointment with a regular MD at 1:30 today. I need some sleep so that I can think straight. Pat

Posts.Content: May 18, 2008 12:08AM Patti746 wrote: I don't drink, but I did smoke. I had my surgery at Sloan-Kettering hospital in New York in Dec.2007. When I filled out the application, of course they ask if you smoke, I said yes. 3 people came in to see me and asked if I would be in a clinical trial. They gave me a little hand held computer. It rang when I was to have a cigarette. At this time I was up to 2 packs a day. Each day the computer decreased the # of cigarettes I was to have. It is now May 2008 and I have not had a cigarette to this day (5 months).
Posts.Title: Smoking;Drinking and Chemotherapy! jacquibutterfly EyesOTex

Posts.Content: Patti746 wrote: I finished my chemo treatment in June in California. I came home to CT to finish 6 months of Herceptin. I have had so many CAT scans & MRI's, it's not funny anymore. The doctor that I am going to now is concerned about nodules on my lungs (I had them with my first CAT scan) and they have since shrunk. I wake up every morning and my stomach goes into knots (the first thing I think of is maybe I have more cancer). It's starting to take over all my thoughts. Does anyone out there have any suggestions. Pat Dx 11/10/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, 1/20 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
